section.title: $u.n.toStr(NUMBER as number, DECIMALPLACE as number , FORMAT as string, PREFIX as string, SUFFIX as string)
section.description: Convert a number into a string. The second parameter allows you to specify decimal places to round to. The optional third parameter specifies format flags. Format flags are:

case.description: "B" - return a black string if the number equals "0".

"," - place commas in the number to separate thousands (comma string used is stored in $u.comma, decimal string is stored in $u.decimal - you can change these values if you wish to use some other separators).
"-" - use a "-" before the number if it is negative.
"(" - bracket the number in parentheses if it is negative.

section.description:
The fourth and fifth parameters allow you to specify an optional prefix and suffix.
Example

section.title: $u.n.toPlaceStr(NUMBER as number)
section.description: Convert a number into a place string (i.e. "1st", "2nd", "3rd", "4th", "105th"...) Example

section.title: $u.n.round(NUMBER as number, DECIMALPLACE as number, DIRECTION as string)
section.description: Round a number to the given decimal place. The direction optional argument allows you to specify the direction you want to round. The "direction" flag has three possible values:

case.description: "normal" - if the value of the digit after the rounding decimal point is less then 5 round down, otherwise round up. This is the default behavior.
